Consider a web application that stores user information in a relational database with two tables: users and roles. The users table contains columns user_id, username, password, and role_id. The roles table contains columns role_id and role_name. Each user can have one role assigned to them.
Given this scenario, which SQL query would retrieve the usernames of users who have the role "Admin"?
options: SELECT username FROM users WHERE role_id = 1;
SELECT username FROM users WHERE role_name = 'Admin';
SELECT username FROM users JOIN roles ON users.role_id = roles.role_id WHERE roles.role_name = 'Admin';
SELECT username FROM users JOIN roles ON users.role_id = roles.role_id AND roles.role_name = 'Admin';
